name: platris (eieio)
description:
Alright so this is a game I made to learn a bit about making games in Godot.  The last game I made was in high school.  This game is not good.  The first player to play it called it "anxiety inducing."  You're definitely on this page because I sent you this link.

ANYWAY here are the rules:

  • Play tetris on the left screen with WASD / R / Z (hold piece).
  • Move the guy on the right with IJKL.  
  • Clear the little beams on the right by clearing a row at the same height in tetris on the left.
  • Stomp on the red buttons to clear a tetris row for free!  We're giving away row clears here. 
  • Hit "O" when your guy is at the computer on the right to...do something.  Figure that one out yourself. It's important to preserve a sense of mystery even in the age of the internet.
  • Make it to the flowers at the top to win.
  • Get frustrated, quit, tell me that the game was great and you had a great time.  

Everyone got it?  Cool.

I ended up hand-drawing the assets for this game but used a whole bunch of public assets during development.  Thank you very much to l-gad and zegley in particular for saving me a bunch of time as I was exploring Godot :)
